history.title: Requests History
history.emptyMessage: You haven't executed any requests! <block>It's empty here. Try:</block>

variablesGuide.title: Using variables in requests
variablesGuide.intro: Variables allow you to create dynamic requests that can be easily modified without manually editing the URL, headers, or request body.
variablesGuide.syntaxDescription: To use a variable, specify its name in double curly braces:

features.storage: Variables are stored in your browser's local storage
features.autoload: The application will automatically load previously saved variables after successful authentication
features.lazyLoad: Variable code is loaded only for authenticated users

tips.naming: Give variables clear names that reflect their purpose
tips.confidential: Use variables for confidential data (tokens, API keys)
tips.validation: Check that all variables used are defined (highlighted in green)

variablesGuide.conclusion: Now you can create flexible requests that are easily adaptable to different usage scenarios!
